definition: a glance/a quick look/a glimpse
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 yan3

definition: to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 yan3

definition: as far as the eye can see
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to shoot a glance at
at first glance/at first sight

sentences.english: Vernet glanced at the key but made no move to touch it.
sentences.chinese: 韋爾內看了一眼那把鑰匙，卻沒有去動它。

sentences.english: The inspectors soon saw through his scheme to avoid paying income tax.
sentences.chinese: 稽查員一眼就看穿了他企圖逃避繳納所得的詭計。

sentences.english: The child glanced at his angry father timidly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子怯生生地瞟了一眼怒氣衝衝的父親。

sentences.english: None of them thought of looking at the ricks.
sentences.chinese: 他們誰也沒想到要看麥垛一眼。

sentences.english: Your first sight of qingyuan will definitely be impressive.
sentences.chinese: 當你第一眼看見清遠會立即使你眼前一亮。

sentences.english: She gave me a dirty look and finally turned around to get my coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她惡狠狠的看我一眼，最後才轉過去拿咖啡。

sentences.english: I just cast a glance at the headlines .
He read a few lines, and looked wrathfully at Berg.
sentences.chinese: 他念了幾行，便兇狠地瞟了貝格一眼。

sentences.english: Examples : She took a last look in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 她在鏡中望了最後一眼。
納佐林機靈地看了她一眼。

sentences.english: The students didn’t even stare blankly at me.
sentences.chinese: 學生們甚至不肯茫然擡頭看我一眼。

sentences.english: Don Fernando gave me a look that seemed to bore a hole in me.
sentences.chinese: 費南多先生甩了我一眼，眼神犀利好像要刺穿我身體。

sentences.english: His mouth was wide open--I could see far down into caverns of pale pink throat.
sentences.chinese: 它的嘴巴大張着，能一眼看見它淡粉色喉嚨的深處。

sentences.english: Open widely water sweep one eye beard spring, pulled a his hand to walk.
sentences.chinese: 張大水掃一眼胡春，拉了他的手就走。

sentences.english: And you no longer look with love on me.
sentences.chinese: 不要可憐我，雖然你不再看我一眼，熱望已退。

definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to turn one's head/to turn around
(dialect) to look at
to cast a glance
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
recognition/to recognize
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
expression or emotion showing in one's eyes/meaningful glance/wink/eyesight (dialect)
to look face to face
coldly
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
